meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: Islamic hardliners may have issued a slew of fatwas against digital technology, including chat programmes and the use of Koranic verses as ring tones. But Muslims have embraced the internet and smartphones just as the rest of the world has—and, in some ways, even more.

div.a: Facebook Now The Web’s Second-Most-Popular Video Site

div.div: Facebook users love video. So much so that the social network recently trumped Yahoo as the Internet’s second-most-popular video site.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NO8RfN&via=Digg&text=Facebook Now The Web’s Second-Most-Popular Video Site

div.div: After two years of effort, an international team of 65 scientists, policymakers and environmentalists has completed the first phase of what might appear to be an impossible task: assessing the health of the ocean and assigning it a 'score'.

div.a: What Would Happen If The Entire World Lived Like Americans?

div.div: How many natural resources would we need if the entire world’s population consumed them like Americans do? More than we have.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QJd6cR&via=Digg&text=What Would Happen If The Entire World Lived Like Americans?

div.a: Watch Nellie The Sea Otter Stack Cups

div.div: Guaranteed to be the best video of an otter stacking cups you've ever seen.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NKq4eR&via=Digg&text=Watch Nellie The Sea Otter Stack Cups

div.a: Mat Honan: How I Got My Digital Life Back After An Epic Hacking

div.div: Yes, you can die by the cloud. But you can live by it too. Here’s how I regained my digital life after it was taken away from me.

li.div: The moral of this story is to use long, non-gibberish passwords for accounts you might need to recover: wired.com/gadgetlab/2012/0...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NNA7uY&via=Digg&text=Mat Honan: How I Got My Digital Life Back After An Epic Hacking

div.div: BUT HOW LONG WILL THE CHARGE LAST?

div.a: Scientists Develop Rapidly Charging Lithium-Ion Battery

div.div: A group of Korean scientists have developed a fast-charge lithium-ion battery that can be recharged 30 to 120 times faster than conventional li-ion batteries.

As much as we’d rather not admit it, jerks often get ahead in our world — usually at the expense of a lot of other people along the way. Psychological research over the past few years is revealing why. As it turns out, acting like a jerk isn’t the secret to reaping the rewards of jerkiness. The real secret is simply letting others place you on a pedestal.

div.a: The Rise Of McDonald's Traced Through Japanese Commercials

div.div: Behold, in bite sized chunks, the rise of the Golden Arches in the Land of the Rising Sun: from its humble beginnings as an edible novelty from a faraway country (then) to becoming Japan’s number one food provider (now).

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PwTav8&via=Digg&text=The Rise Of McDonald's Traced Through Japanese Commercials

div.a: The Chinese Company With A Following That Rivals Apple

div.div: Xiaomi got its start just two years ago with its MIUI skin for Android. Last year, it released its own smartphone, called the Mi-One, and went on to sell over 3.5 million units of the device.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QOTPa2&via=Digg&text=The Chinese Company With A Following That Rivals Apple

div.a: What Not To Say To The TSA Screener

div.div: Does the TSA intentionally keep passengers waiting? If there is such a policy, it is almost certainly an unofficial one.

li.div: Doesn't get any sadder MT @elliottdotorg 87% of ppl afraid to use 1st Amendment right while traveling U.S. elliott.org/blog/5-things-... @billycorben

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QeJUKn&via=Digg&text=What Not To Say To The TSA Screener

div.a: Senate Candidate: Victims Of 'Legitimate Rape' Don't Get Pregnant

div.div: Rep. Todd Akin, the Republican nominee for Senate in Missouri, justified his opposition to abortion rights even in case of rape with a claim that victims of “legitimate rape” have unnamed biological defenses that prevent pregnancy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SEQE6r&via=Digg&text=Senate Candidate: Victims Of 'Legitimate Rape' Don't Get Pregnant

div.div: Stanford’s self-driving Audi TTS instead has the need for speed. The Audi, known as Shelley, sped around the Thunderhill Raceway track north of Sacramento topping 120 miles per hour on straightaways.

li.div: Stanford’s Self-Driving Car Tears It Up On Racetrack – Tops 120 MPH singularityhub.com/2012/08/19/... Does it have an "outrun the cops" algorithm?

div.a: Scientists Search For Cause Of Elephant Man's Death

div.div: For over a century scientists have been baffled by what caused the terrible disfigurement of the Elephant Man Joseph Merrick. Now they will attempt to unlock the secret of his suffering by analyzing DNA from his bones - and hope to finally diagnose his condition.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NPmXiJ&via=Digg&text=Scientists Search For Cause Of Elephant Man's Death

div.a: Is Your Building Filled With Junk That Makes It Hard To Breathe?

div.div: Quick! Hold your breath. The air you’re breathing right now is filled with chemicals that might be slowly giving you asthma. It might be the materials your building is built with, or it might be the frogs. That’s right: frogs.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TJVLo4&via=Digg&text=Is Your Building Filled With Junk That Makes It Hard To Breathe?

div.a: Why Waiting In Line Is Torture

div.div: The experience of waiting, whether for luggage or groceries, is defined only partly by the objective length of the wait.

li.div: Hey, frequent flyers! Ever wonder why they put the baggage claim so far from plane? It's not an accident: nytimes.com/2012/08/19/opi...
